Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery flanged lid; underside reserved; top slipped white: from centre: tongue pattern; wide black band; frieze of concentric circles linked by triple lines decorated with petals; black band; row of dots at rim.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins Boston 88.1085 and belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.499.c. The Boston sherd is identified as having been found in the Sanctuary of the Dioskouroi. In all likelihood, so did the other sherds. Lemos identifies the sherd as belonging to a plate, but the flange makes it clear that it comes from a lid.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 244, no. 267)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2160) (phase 2)
